name: Aarakocra
description: A proud warrior nation involved in most conflicts, often siding with those they deem 'virtuous'. Respected but seen as self-serving.

name: Drow
description: Relatives of Elves, often mistrusted. Surface Drow are more mellow; Underdark Drow tend to remain guarded and harsh.

name: Elf
description: Considered second-class due to a role in the Elven Cataclysm. Some seek integration, while many remain in seclusion.

name: Goblin
description: Tribal, reckless, and spirited. Their nature makes cohabitation with other races difficult.

name: Human
description: Formerly dominant, now integrated across the world. Adaptable and found in most societies.

name: Orc
description: Technologically advanced, proud, and philosophical. Orcish cities are hubs of innovation.

name: Tabaxi
description: Desert and tundra dwellers, adaptable and politically influential through magic and royalty.

name: Goliath
description: Competitive and physically formidable. Rarely leave their native peaks.

name: Halfling
description: Trustworthy and cozy folk, known for surviving among larger beings.

name: Half-Orc
description: Walk the line between two heritages, often judged by both.

name: Kenku
description: Voiceless mimics with tribal roots. Found where mimicry is a benefit.

name: Leonin
description: Muscular warriors, infrequently leave home. Noted for combat prowess.

name: Lizardfolk
description: Swamp dwellers. Often ignored, they thrive in political shadows.

name: Owlin
description: Bookish and isolated, they delve into knowledge and introspection.

name: Tortle
description: Slow-paced and seaside-dwelling. Calm demeanor with culinary renown.

name: Bugbear
description: Giant goblinoids, elusive and rarely travel in groups.

name: Dragonborn
description: Noble warriors, nearly extinct outside Kalheim. Known for protection and valor.

name: Half-Elf
description: Children of Elves and other races, often viewed with even more disdain than their Elven parents.

name: Harengon
description: Agile, dexterous jungle farmers with high metabolisms and boundless energy.

name: Loxodon
description: Massive nomads with merchant hearts and unmatched culinary skill.

name: Minotaur
description: Boisterous but often misunderstood. Seen more as beasts than people.

name: Tiefling
description: Reviled and hunted, often live in disguise. Viewed as cursed or demonic.

name: Yuan-ti
description: Serpentine and ritual-born. Struggle to integrate due to their eerie appearance.

name: Aasimar
description: Born of Elves or Drow with no clear pattern. Seen as divine omens.

name: Eladrin
description: Fey-touched Elves with seasonal attunements. Born of high mana conditions.

name: Air Genasi
region: Elementally disturbed areas, often near high altitudes or open skies
description: Born during planar turbulence affecting the Elemental Plane of Air, they embody aspects of the wind and sky.

name: Earth Genasi
region: Elementally disturbed areas, often near mountains or underground
description: Born during planar turbulence affecting the Elemental Plane of Earth, they embody aspects of stone, soil, and resilience.

name: Fire Genasi
region: Elementally disturbed areas, often near volcanoes or intense heat
description: Born during planar turbulence affecting the Elemental Plane of Fire, they embody aspects of flame, heat, and intensity.

name: Water Genasi
region: Elementally disturbed areas, often near coastlines, rivers, or large bodies of water
description: Born during planar turbulence affecting the Elemental Plane of Water, they embody aspects of waves, currents, and the fluid nature of water.

name: Githyanki
description: Planar travelers, possibly banished or extinct. Shrouded in myth.

name: Gnome
description: Playful and rare Feyfolk. Little is known; they may not have any homeland.

name: Shifter
description: Children of lycanthropes with bestial traits. Live in hiding or nomadic bands.

name: Triton
description: Aquatic beings rarely seen. Said to dwell in underwater cities and reefs.
